intro: Cestichis microblepharon, commonly known as the small-eyed cestichis, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its delicate, palmate leaves and showy, pale pink to white flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are clustered in inflorescences and are known to attract various pollinators, including bees and butterflies. The plant's botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural study and ecological research.
